section.p: A manufacturer of synthetic fibers examines whether the shrinking of the fibers is related to the temperature at which they are washed. There are 8 experiments in which the fibers are washed at different temperatures. The measured shrinkage is listed below as a percentage of the original length.

fig.title: Results shrink percentage and temperature of washing

image.alt: Results shrink percentage and temperature of washing

ol.li: Imagine a linear relationship and determine the equation where the shrink percentage is a function from the temperature.
Predict the shrinkage at a temperature of 65 oC.

section.title: Answer
section.codeblock: Shrink percentage= 0.0796*Temp - 3.546 At a temperature of 65 oC the predicted shrinkage percentage is 1.6%.

section.title: Solution
section.p: The independent variable (x) is the temperature and the dependent variable (y) is the shrink percentage. Determine the slope of the line with the function SLOPE() and the interception with the y-axis with the function INTERCEPT().
Formula for shrink percentage at 65 oC is = 0.0796*65 - 3.546
